name: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review
description: Flashcards reviewing quiz concepts from AWS Cloud Technical Essentials Module 4

cards.front: You're setting up Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling. Which three components must you configure for it to function properly?
cards.back: You need a launch template or launch configuration, an EC2 Auto Scaling group, and scaling policies.
cards.example: To automatically scale an app based on CPU usage, you'd define a launch template, create an Auto Scaling group with desired capacity, and apply scaling policies.
cards.mnemonic: L.A.S. = Launch, Auto Scaling group, Scaling policy
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: You need a load balancer that automatically scales and integrates with EC2 Auto Scaling. Which AWS service provides this functionality?
cards.back: Elastic Load Balancing (ELB) supports automatic scaling and integrates with EC2 Auto Scaling to register instances automatically.
cards.example: When new EC2 instances are launched by Auto Scaling, ELB automatically begins sending traffic to them.
cards.mnemonic: ELB = Elastic Load Balancing + Elastic Scaling
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: True or False: When using ELB with Auto Scaling, you must manually register new EC2 instances with the load balancer.
cards.back: False. ELB automatically registers new instances launched by Auto Scaling.
cards.example: As EC2 Auto Scaling adds instances to handle demand, ELB updates its target list without user intervention.
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: Your application must route traffic based on URL paths like '/images'. Which type of load balancer should you use?
cards.back: Use an Application Load Balancer (ALB), which supports routing based on HTTP data such as URL paths.
cards.example: ALB routes requests to /upload to one group of instances, and /download to another.
cards.mnemonic: A for ALB, A for Application-aware routing
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: What are the two main ways to scale an application in AWS?
cards.back: Applications can be scaled vertically (adding power to a single instance) or horizontally (adding more instances).
cards.example: Upgrading an EC2 instance type is vertical scaling; adding more EC2s behind an ALB is horizontal scaling.
cards.mnemonic: VH = Vertical adds Horsepower, Horizontal adds Hosts
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: Which element in a CloudWatch dashboard lets you visualize metrics like CPU or latency?
cards.back: Widgets are used to display and analyze metrics in a CloudWatch dashboard.
cards.example: A line graph widget could show CPU utilization over time for your EC2 instance.
cards.mnemonic: Widgets Work as Windows into metrics
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: What are the three possible states of a CloudWatch metric alarm?
cards.example: If CPU > 80% for 5 minutes, alarm enters ALARM state; otherwise it's OK or INSUFFICIENT_DATA if data is missing.
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: What kind of data is collected by VPC Flow Logs?
cards.back: VPC Flow Logs collect data about network traffic going into and out of a VPC.
cards.example: Flow logs can show IP addresses accessing your database subnet for security auditing.
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: Why is monitoring AWS resources beneficial to your business?
cards.back: Monitoring helps identify security threats, performance issues, and anomalies early, enabling proactive response.
cards.example: Monitoring helps detect a traffic spike that might indicate a DDoS attack or misconfiguration.
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review

cards.front: True or False: When building a serverless app with AWS Lambda, configuring VPC and subnets is always necessary.
cards.back: False. Lambda functions by default run in a secure VPC managed by AWS, with internet access.
cards.example: You donâ€™t need to configure VPCs unless you want your Lambda to access private resources like RDS.
cards.subject: AWS Cloud Essentials Quiz Review
